newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan may discuss using public funds for bad loans.
newsitem.headline: Japan may discuss using public funds for bad loans.

text.p: Parliament may have to consider using public funds to solve financial institutions' bad loan problems when it debates the issue of loan disclosure, Japanese political leaders said on Sunday.

Naoto Kan of the opposition Democratic Party said in a televised program parliament needed to discuss the proper disclosure of problem loans among Japanese financial institutions and the possibility of using public funds.
Ruling Liberal Democratic Party Secretary Koichi Kato and Takeo Nishioka of opposition Shinshinto both agreed with Kan.
The party officials did not specify how the public funds were to be used. In the past, the government used public funds to help close the failed mortgage firms, which drew a huge public outry.

The Ministry of Finance's official estimate of problem loans among deposit-taking financial institutions in Japan is 23 trillion yen. Kan said some analysts estimate the figure could reach as much as 100 trillion yen.
